attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I am particularly insensed by what is happening on the south coast and the 'managed retreat' strategy being discussed by Chichester District Council for the Pagham to East Head stretch of the West Sussex coastline.  I along with others have been fighting for some time to get a sensible solution for well known East Head to ensure the future protection of the village of West Wittering which will be under threat.  East Head is a jewel on the south coast enjoyed by many and will no doubt disappear because of the 'new' approach.  There is no place for apathy anywhere in the UK as this current 'do nothing' policy of government threatens all our low lying coastline, the local industries and most importantly, the people.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "not abdicate the government's responsibility to provide proper sea defences to our coastal regions. Let's face it 'managed retreat' is just an excuse to save money not part of a sensible long term strategy to protect our coastline and the people who live there."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here:
